summary: This document is an email chain between attorney Michael Bachner and federal prosecutors regarding an attorney proffer for an unnamed female client (Ms. [REDACTED]) in the Epstein case. The emails discuss scheduling, confirm legal protections for the proffer, and address questions about the client's visits to Epstein properties.

persons.name: Michael Bachner
persons.context: Attorney representing an unnamed female client (Ms. [REDACTED]) in communications with federal prosecutors regarding an attorney proffer. He provides information about his client's interactions with Epstein and coordinates meetings.

connections.description: Michael Bachner is the legal representative for the unnamed female client, providing attorney proffers to prosecutors on her behalf.

events.title: Attorney Proffer Meeting Scheduled
events.description: Michael Bachner confirms a meeting with prosecutors to provide an attorney proffer regarding his client Ms. [REDACTED], with discussions about legal protections under FRE 408 and 410.

events.title: Follow-up Questions About Epstein Properties
events.description: Prosecutors ask whether Ms. [REDACTED] visited Epstein properties beyond New York and Palm Beach, specifically inquiring about New Mexico ranch, Little St. James Island, Great St. James Island, and Paris residence.

events.title: Scheduling Coordination
events.description: Michael Bachner provides dates that are unavailable for a potential meeting between prosecutors and his client Ms. [REDACTED].

keyFacts: Prosecutors are investigating an unnamed female client's (Ms. [REDACTED]) connections to Jeffrey Epstein, specifically her visits to his properties.
The attorney proffer process includes legal protections under Federal Rules of Evidence 408 and 410 for the client's statements.
Prosecutors confirmed the attorney proffers received did not change their view of Ms. [REDACTED]'s status in the investigation.
The next investigative step discussed is a direct conversation between prosecutors and Ms. [REDACTED], which would be voluntary.
The client reportedly stayed in Epstein's Paris apartment with her family on one occasion.
